page.title: 08ST. MARY'S CHURCH.
page.content: The oldest part of this{Norman}church is the base of the tower which dates from the end of the 12th century. A probable{Saxon}Cross is built into the outside of the North wall suggesting a possible earlier church on the site. The chancel is{Early English}but the nave was rebuilt in 1841 and added at the same time were the aisles and the south porch. The nave was again rebuilt after a fire in 1867. Brought into the Church after the fire was the beautiful early{15th century}pulpit once in the old parish church of Milton until it was destroyed together with the village. The font also dates back to the{15th century.}Born in 1862 to the then Rector of Whitechurch was Samuel Wesley father of{Charles and {John Wesley.}This beautiful church attracts many visitors from all over the world.
